intro: Lagarosolen hechiensis, commonly known as the Hekien rock orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species native to China. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and unique floral structure, with flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. The plant thrives in rocky and limestone habitats, often growing in crevices or on cliffs. Its botanical features include fleshy roots and a short, upright stem with few leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
